title: BRIEFINGS: IMMIGRATION; NUMBERS SURGE
body:
The number of illegal immigrants in New Jersey more than doubled in the last decade, according to estimates 
last week by the Immigration and Naturalization Service. It says the state is home to 221,000 immigrants without 
documents, up from 95,000 in 1990 and representing 3.2 percent of the state's population.   Jeremy Pearce

http://www.nytimes.com
